<p>```{r pkgs, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}</p>
<h1 id="initialize-environment">Initialize Environment</h1>
<p>#########################</p>

<h1 id="set-cran-location-for-installing-packages">Set CRAN location for installing packages</h1>
<p>############################################
r &lt;- getOption(“repos”)
r[“CRAN”] &lt;- “http://cran.wustl.edu”
options(repos = r)
rm(r)</p>

<h2 id="helper-function-to-install-a-cran-package-if-not-installed-and-load">Helper function to install a CRAN package if not installed and load</h2>
<p>######################################################################
use_package &lt;- function(p) {
if (!is.element(p, installed.packages()[,1]))
  install.packages(p, dep = TRUE)
library(p, character.only = TRUE)
}</p>

<h1 id="load-base-r-libraries-no-need-to-install">Load base R libraries (no need to install)</h1>
<p>#############################################
library(grid)</p>

<h1 id="check-and-install-cran-packages-may-need-more">Check and install CRAN packages (may need more)!!!!!!</h1>
<p>#######################################################
use_package(‘png’) # For importing pngs
use_package(‘grImport2’) # For importing svg graphics
use_package(‘TDA’)
use_package(‘ggplot2’) # For some nice plots based in the grid package</p>

&lt;!--- the syntax '---' creates a line seperator, a nice way to split up concepts --&gt;

---

## Content
Blibbity blah blah, here is my sweet content, add yours here.


### Subsections
Blibbity blah blah, this is a subsection, make as many or as few as you'd like using increasing numbers of # symbols.

### Subsection with code chunk
Here's how to add a code chunk:

```{r plot_two_Circles, message=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
library('TDA')
library('spatstat')

x &lt;- circleUnif(50,10)
plot(x, pch = 18, xlab = "", ylab = "")
</code></pre></div></div>

<p>Or if we just want plots and not the code that generated them:</p>

<p>```{r plot_two_Circles_Again, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
library(‘TDA’)
library(‘spatstat’)
x &lt;- circleUnif(100,1.5)
Nice_Cycle &lt;- as.ppp.data.frame(x,c(-2,2,-2,2))
plot(Nice_Cycle, pch = 18, xlab = “”, ylab = “”)</p>

<p>xppp &lt;- as.ppp.data.frame(Nice_Cycle,c(-2,2,-2,2))
Angsty_Cycle &lt;-rjitter(xppp,0.25)
plot(Angsty_Cycle, pch = 16, xlab = “”, ylab = “”)</p>
